availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Laura Virginia Gaar Baldwin on August 8, 1864 in Jefferson County, Kentucky. Plasterer in Floyd County, Indiana in 1850. Served as a major in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry until January 1864. Served as colonel in 5th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry from January 1864 to his resignation on March 25, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 907.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0050.
Find A Grave, "Oliver Leonard Baldwin (1835-1865)," Memorial #100674443, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/100674443 (accessed June 10, 2019).
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Floyd, New Albany, p. 336A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film # 000482710.
